title: Post Title
text: 2–3 sentences: what problem this addresses, main takeaway, and who it’s for.

title: Post Title
text: 2–3 sentences: what problem this addresses, main takeaway, and who it’s for.

title: Post Title
text:
1. Motivation & Problem

Why does this topic matter?
What gap or pain does it address?
What will the reader learn or be able to do after reading?

title: Post Title
text:
2. Background / Related Work

Minimal context needed to follow the post.
Key prior ideas, papers, or tools (with links).
How this post relates to or differs from them.

title: Post Title
text:
3. Main Content

3.1 Core idea or method

Central concept, algorithm, or design.
Short definitions if needed.
One focused example or diagram if it helps.



3.2 Implementation or walkthrough (optional)

Steps, code snippets, or configs.
Enough detail to reproduce, without turning into full docs.



3.3 Results or evaluation (optional)

What you measured or observed.
Tables/figures if useful.
Caveats and limitations.

title: Post Title
text:
4. Discussion

Practical implications.
When to use (or not use) this approach.
Open questions or future directions.

title: Post Title
text:
5. Takeaways & References

3–5 bullet takeaways.
Key papers, posts, or repos (with links).


Template: duplicate this outline for new technical posts and fill in each section.
